result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael V Schroble Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 141 days were granted if revoked. Transfer allowed to  Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be determined at a future hearing.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases.

No contact with victim Heidi J. or Darik N. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent.
Comply with any Mental Health/Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. 
May be transferred to Milwaukee County. Sentence credit of 399 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.
Costs previously imposed are still owed as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael V Schroble in court, in custody, with Attorney David L Herring.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing on revocation.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Herring makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

2 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 399 days)   *May be transferred to Milwaukee County*
  -  1 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18  MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____ Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha

COSTS:  $543.90 - DUE AS A CONDITION OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION, AS PREVIOUSY ORDERED

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 4, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael V Schroble appears by videoconference from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, in custody.  Attorney David L Herring appears on behalf of Defendant.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Herring requests an adjournment as he is still in negotiations with the state.  Court adjourns.    Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from MSFD.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for May 4, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on March 24, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Attorney David L Herring in court.   Defendant Michael V Schroble did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court tried to get Defendant by videoconference for approximately 45 minutes.  Staff at MSDF stated they would have him ready, however no one was at videoconference room after 3 attempts.  Attorney Herring requests an adjournment.  Court adjourns.  Defendant may appear by videoconference for next court date.  Hearing scheduled for March 24, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Attorney David L Herring in court.   Defendant Michael V Schroble did not appear.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in custody at Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.  Court adjourns.  Defendant may appear by videoconference from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for February 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Attorney David Herring is appointed counsel for the defendant
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 17, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
